message:
Installing Debian SphinUX (made by Egyptians) inside VirtualBox

Comment:
- Not bad for a non-Ubuntu linux
- But still seems to be a very early preview (although when I googled its news it seemed they've been readifying this since maybe 2009 or before)
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message: Ok, so it is yet another Debian based distro running KDE, what about using Kubuntu

Well, I wouldn't use it myself, but it's a nice watch. First, I tried to google other earlier so-called Egyptian Linux tries when someone else mentioned it here with the intention of saying this is not the first, and isn't serious, but the search results made me understand the guys working on it have been doing so and known for it for several years.

Not sure how much customized it is on top of Debian. I just liked that the guy didn't sound like .. not sure how to say it but one of those dreams completely unrelated to the realities, was good to find out he sounded sane ya3ny if you see what I mean. I wouldn't use it myself or see a benefit in using it, but it's still a bit interesting.
